pr_title: New module for user virt attribute tcsMails

timeline.message:
New module for user virt attribute tcsMails

 - it will compute values from different email attributes (affected) to one.
 This value then will be used for purpose of TCS
 - it also reacts on messages with changes in affected attributes
 - tests for modules were added

timeline.bodyText: Since you end each branch with single return true; you can probably remove else from all branches and simply return false at the end if no previous if was true.
timeline.author: zlamalp

timeline.bodyText: I would probably prefer more MU specific attribute name or usage of namespace, since request for TCS mails attribute might be required by others, but they will require own source attributes (different implementation). But for now, there is nobody else requiring it, so its just suggestion.
timeline.author: zlamalp

replies.bodyText: Name was changed to have namespace mu in it.
replies.author: stavamichal

timeline.author: zlamalp

timeline.bodyText: You have this unused variable countries in all tests. Why?
timeline.author: zlamalp

timeline.bodyText: You don't have to throw InternalErrorException in any of these methods :)
timeline.author: balcirakpeter

timeline.bodyText: Exceptions WrongReferenceAttributeValueException and WrongAttributeAssignmentException are not thrown in this method.
timeline.author: balcirakpeter

timeline.bodyText: Use new ArrayList<>(tcsMailsValue) to prevent Unchecked call warning.
timeline.author: balcirakpeter

timeline.bodyText:
This code is duplicate. Moreover, repeated "add" operations are not necessary.
You can use something like this:
		return Arrays.asList(
			A_U_D_preferredMail, 
			A_U_D_ISMail, 
			A_U_D_publicAliasMails, 
			A_U_D_privateAliasMails, 
			A_U_D_o365EmailAddressesMU);
timeline.author: balcirakpeter
balcirakpeter

replies.bodyText: I don't think it is necessary and it is easier to read the simple version than the shorter one.
replies.author: stavamichal
